item.title: New Features in Prometheus 2.23.0
item.dc:creator: Brian Brazil
item.description: Prometheus 2.23.0 is now out, following on from 2.22.0 with many fixes and improvements. There's been a variety of performance improvements to the TSDB. item.title: New Features in Prometheus 2.22.0
item.dc:creator: Brian Brazil
item.description: Prometheus 2.22.0 is now out, following on from 2.21.0 with many fixes and improvements. There are two new metrics, rule_group_last_evaluation_samples will help you track expensive rule groups and prometheus_tsdb_data_replay_duration_seconds will provide the how long the WAL replay took at startup. item.title: New Features in Prometheus 2.21.0
item.dc:creator: Brian Brazil
item.description: Prometheus 2.21.0 is now out, following on from 2.20.0 with many fixes and improvements. You can now use durations like 1m30s in PromQL, config files, and command line flags. target_limit is a new emergency relief valve, should a scrape config have more targets than this then their scrapes will fail. There's two new service discoveries, Eureka and Hetzner. Kubernetes […]

item.title: New Features in Prometheus 2.20.0
item.dc:creator: Brian Brazil
item.description: Prometheus 2.20.0 is now out, following on from 2.19.0 with many fixes and improvements. WAL compression mentioned briefly in previous post is now enabled by default, some saving disk space and iops for a small CPU cost. There's also been performance improvements to regex matchers. item.title: New Features in Prometheus 2.19.0
item.dc:creator: Brian Brazil
item.description: Prometheus 2.19.0 is now out, following on from 2.18.0 with many fixes and improvements. The big new feature if that full chunks in the TSDB head block are now stored in mmaped, rather than on the heap. This reduces memory requirements particularly for higher frequency scraping, and allows for faster restarts. There's also been improvements in isolation performance. Triton […]

item.title: New Features in Prometheus 2.18.0
item.dc:creator: Brian Brazil
item.description: Prometheus 2.18.0 is now out, following on from 2.17.0 with many fixes and improvements. This is a fairly light release. The most notable change is that the amount of WAL kept on disk has been halved from 6 to 3 hours, which came out of my research for a previous blog post. Federation now only queries the local TSDB, […]

item.title: New Features in Prometheus 2.17.0
item.dc:creator: Brian Brazil
item.description: Prometheus 2.17.0 is now out, following on from 2.16.0 with many fixes and improvements. The big change in this release is that isolation has been added to the tsdb. This means that queries will no longer see partial scrapes, avoiding a number of race conditions such as with histograms. This does use a bit more memory and CPU, but […]

item.title: New Features in Prometheus 2.16.0

item.description: Prometheus 2.16.0 is now out, following on from 2.15.0 with many fixes and improvements. There's more performance improvements in this release. item.title: New Features in Prometheus 2.13.0
